existing_custody_order.reasoning: Complaint expressly pleads an existing March 12, 2019 custody order providing 50/50 shared physical custody on a week-on/week-off rotation (¶2.1) and asserts venue because the prior order was entered by this Court (¶1.4).

specific_modification_sought.reasoning: Complaint identifies specific relief: award primary physical custody to Petitioner, modify Respondent’s parenting time to a safety-consistent schedule (including supervised/assisted visits or other conditions), and seeks temporary pendente lite primary custody pending hearing (¶2.2, ¶4.2, ¶6.1, ¶8).

material_substantial_change.reasoning: Complaint alleges a material and substantial change: within the past year Respondent was diagnosed with a progressive neurological condition causing balance problems, multiple falls, and physical limitations; treating physician advised Respondent not be alone with the child in risky situations (¶3.2–3.3); Respondent has relied on the child for physical assistance and has fallen in the child's presence, creating a new safety risk (¶3.4–3.5).

best_interests_of_child.reasoning: Complaint ties the alleged change to the child's best interests, alleging the prior 50/50 schedule now exposes the child to an unjustified safety risk and that modification to primary custody with safety-based parenting time will protect the child while preserving the parent–child relationship (¶3.7, ¶7.1, ¶4.2).
